reviews.review_msg: Furukawa sensei was a caring, engaging, and sympathetic professor. In order to succeed in her class, you need to study at home during your free time, and make sure to watch the lecture videos. The classes are only there to supplement what you have learnt at home.

This class moves fast and is very tough, it was by far the most work of any of my classes. That being said, if you are up for that, this class is a very well made and lost of fun if you are committed to it! Make sure to get the in physical textbook and a Genkouyoushi notebook for writing! You will have a good time in Furukawa's Class for sure!!

Pretty good professor when it came to feedback and engagement. The structure of the class itself wasn't amazing, but I'm pretty sure that's not in her control. As long as you have access to the Genki I textbook and workbook, you can get 90% of the course of what the course offers if you self study.

Just a really sweet lady who rejuvenated my interest in learning Japanese. Shoe focuses on making the class fun, and tries to teach you not just the language, but also cultural elements as well. I learned not just Japanese, but about Japan as well. Only complaint is that she has to cancel/move move class online a lot.
Furukawa was a great prof who explained grammar and language concepts well. I'm very glad I decided to take her class!

The best Professor I've ever take in SFU, easy going and respectful. She helped a lot with both course relative or non-relatives material, you can even ask her Japanese question during the holiday, so glad to take her class

JAPN100 was the most enjoyable course I took. The quality dipped when moved online, but this is absolutely worth taking when offline if you are interested in picking up jp. You can tell she really enjoys teaching the class, fellow weebs are encouraged to join. If you want to get a headstart, buy the v3 GENKI 1 workbook and dl the v2 textbook.

Furukawa Sensei is really nice and caring towards her students. She teaches Japanese with passion and responds nicely to students' questions about Japanese in general. She quickly responds to emails and is generous in her marking scheme. I would love to take upper Japanese courses with her again in the future.
